_exec_summary.SummaryText:
a.     THE MORRISVILLE BOROUGH MUNICIPAL AUTHORITY OPERATES THE MORRISVILLE WATER FILTRATION PLANT LOCATED AT 405 RIVER ROAD WITHIN LOWER MAKEFIELD TOWNSHIP, AND THE COUNTY OF BUCKS. OUR ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICY IS SUPPORTED WITH POLICIES OF U.S.E.P.A., SARA TITLE III, PA.D.E.P., PA ACT165, AND THE BUCKS COUNTY EMERGENCY RESPONSE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES.

b.     THE CHLORINATION SYSTEM INSTALLED AT CONSTRUCTION DURING 1968, CONSISTS OF TWO ROOMS. THE SCALE ROOM HOLDING TWO ONE TON CYLINDERS MOUNTED ON A SCALE, AND VACUUM REGULATORS MOUNTED ON EACH CYLINDER. THE OTHER ROOM CONTAINS THE RATE SETTERS, EJECTORS AND DISTRIBUTION BOARD. EACH ROOM IS EQUIPPED WITH CHLORINE GAS DETECTION UNITS WITH ALARMS MOUNTED OUTSIDE THE CHLORINE ROOMS AND A REMOTE ALARM INSIDE THE MAIN BUILDING. OUR CHLORINE SYSTEM IS A COMPLETE VACUUM SYSTEM TO REDUCE THE RISK OF LEAKS. EACH ROOM HAS HAD THE VENTILATION SYSTEM UPGRADEDTO INSURE COMPLETE VENTING TO THE OUTSIDE WITH REMOTE EXHAUST FAN SWITCHES. THE LOADING DOCK AREA IS STORAGE FOR A MAXIMUM OF SIX ONE TON CYLINDERS AND ALL EMPTY CYLINDERS. THE WATER PLANT IS MANNED 24 HOURS A DAY, YEAR ROUND WITH A MINIMUM OF TWO EMPLOYEES PER SHIFT.

THE SAFETY EQUIPMENTIS ACCESSIBLE INSIDE THE MAIN BUILDING AWAY FROM POTENTIAL HAZARDOUS LEAK AREAS.
THE ENTIRE CHLORINE AREA IS CHECKED EVERY HOUR BY ONE OF THE OPERATORS ON DUTY.

c.     THE OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS CONSIDERATION OF TWO RELEASE SCENARIOS, THE FIRST BEING WORST CASE SCENARIO, THE SECOND BEING AN ALTERNATE SCENARIO.
THE WORST CASE RELEASE IS DEFINED BY E.P.A. THAT  THE OWNER AND OR OPERATOR SHALL ASSUME THAT THE ... MAXIMUM QUANITY IN THE LARGEST VESSEL ... IS RELEASED AS GAS OVER 10 MINUTES, DUE TO AN UNSPECIFIED FAILURE.
THE ALTERNATIVE SCENARIO IS DEFINED AS  MORE LIKELY TO OCCUR THAN THE WORST- CASE RELEASE SCENARIO.

       THE WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AT THE MORRISVILLE WATER FILTRATION PLANT INVOLVED THE FAILURE OF A ONE TON CHLORINE CYLINDER. USING E.P.A

. MANDATES FOR THIS SCENARIO, NAMELY THE RELEASE OF THE ENTIRE CONTENTS IN 10 MINUTES AS GAS, AND THE USE OF THE TOXIC ENDPOINT:0.0087 mg/l; BASIS: ERPG-2 AND COSIDERATION OF THE POPULATION WITHIN A FULL CIRCLE WITH A RADIUS CORRESPONDING TO THE TOXIC ENDPOINT DISTANCE E.P.A. ALSO MANDATES METEOROLOGICAL CONDITIONS, NAMELY F STABILITY, WIND SPEED OF 1.5 METERS PER SECOND, DAILY TEMPERATURE OF 77 DEGREES f AND AVERAGE HUMIDITY 65%. E.P.A.'S  RMP*VER1.06 WAS USED TO PERFORM OUR WORST-CASE RELEASE. WE HAVE A RADIUS OF 1.3 MILES FROM THE FILTRATION PLANT TO THE ENDPOINT AFFECTING A POPULATION POTENTIAL OF 108,077. DATA IS BASED ON 1990 U.S. CENSUS DATA USING THE LANDVIEW III PROGRAM.THERE ARE SEVERAL PUBLIC RECEPTORS ALSO TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT SUCH AS : SCHOOLS, RESIDENCES, HOSPITALS, PRISONS, HIGHWAYS, PARKS , PUBLIC BUILDINGS,AND THE DELAWARE RIVER. ENVIROMENTAL RECEPTORS TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT ARE: NATIONAL OR STATE PARKS, FORRESTS OR MONUMENTS, AND THE DELAWARE RIVER.

       THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO INVOLVES THE FAILURE OF A VALVE DURING THE CONNECTION OF A VACUUM REGULATOR TO A FULL CHLORINE CYLINDER. THE VACUUM REGULATOR BEING INSTALLED TO THE TOP VALVE [RELEASES GAS ONLY] WAS COMPLETED. WHEN THE CYLINDER VALVE WAS OPENED, IT STARTED LEAKING GAS, AND WAS NOT ABLE TO CLOSE COMPLETELY. THE RESULTING FACTOR WAS TO REMOVE THE VACUUM REGULATOR AND CAP THE VALVE USING THE CHLORINE EMERGENCY REPAIR KIT B. THE AMOUNT OF CHLORINE RELEASED WAS APPROXIMATLY 
51 lbs. OVER A 17 MINUTE PERIOD, EQUALING A RELEASE RATE OF 3 lbs/min.OF A NEUTRALLY BOUYANT PLUME RESULTING IN A TOXIC ENDPOINT: 0.0087mg/l; BASIS ERPG-2,  RESULTING IN A ESTIMATED DISTANCE TOXIC ENDPOINT: <0.1 MILES. FOR THE ERPG-2 THIS WAS CALCULATED USING WIND SPEED: 3 METERS/SECOND, STABILITY CLASS D, AND AIR TEMPERATURE OF 77 DEGREES f. THE E.P.A.'S RMP* COMP VER. 1.06 WAS USED TO PERFORM THIS SCENARIO. THE POPULATION AFFECTED IN THIS SCENARIO IS 111 BASED ON 1990 CENSUS DATA COLLECTED FROM THE LANDVIEW I

II PROGRAM.
PUBLIC RECEPTORS INCLUDED IN THIS SCENARIO ARE RESEIDENCES AND THE DELAWARE RIVER. ENVIROMENTAL RECEPTORS INCLUDED IN THIS SCENARIO ARE NATIONAL OR STATE PARKS, FORRESTS OR MONUMENTS, AND THE DELAWARE RIVER.
       MITIGATION MEASURES TO BE CONSIDERED ARE ACTIVATION OF CHLORINE GAS DETECTORS, AND REPLACEMENT OF ALL PRESSURE LINES WITH A COMPLETE VACUUM SYSTEM. THIS REDUCES SIGNIFICANTLY THE THE AMOUNT OF CHLORINE GAS THAT MAY BE RELEASED. 

d.     THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM FOR THE MORRISVILLE WATER FILTRATION PLANT IS BASED ON THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS:
          . A PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE PROGRAM
          . STATE OF ART PROCESS AND SAFETY EQUIPMENT
          . A HIGH LEVEL OF TRAINING OF OPERATORS
          . WRITTEN EFFECTIVE PROCEEDURES TO BE FOLLOWED
       CHLORINE-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS INCLUDE AVAILABILITY OF SELF-CONTAINED BREATHING APPARATUS [SCBA], TO BE WORN BY OPERATORS. AWARENESS OF THE OF THE TOXIC AND HAZARDOUS PROPERTIES OF CHLORINE, REMOTE EXHAUST FAN SWITCHES AND THE PRESENCE OF GAS DETECTORS WITH REMOTE ALARMS

e.     THIS FACILITY HAS NOT HAD AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF CHLORINE WITHIN THE LAST FIVE YEARS.

f.     THE MORRISVILLE WATER FILTRATION PLANT HAS AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN FILED WITH THE BUCKS COUNTY EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT THAT IS UPDATED AND REVIEWED EVERY YEAR. WE ALSO HAVE OUR OWN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN THAT ADDRESSES ANY CHLORINE EMERGENCIES AS WELL AS ANY OTHER TYPE OF EMERGENCY THAT MAY ARISE AT THE FACILITY. COPIES OF THESE PLANS ARE DISTRIBUTED TO EVERY RESPONDING UNIT WITHIN OUR DISTRICT.
